name: Anonymous
com:
How to roll dice: "dice+2d6" without the quotes in the email field rolls 2d6. "dice+5d42+23" rolls 5d42+23. "noko+dice+2d6" rolls 2d6 without showing the roll in the email field.

In the rules department, you can look at http://www.4chan.org/rules - all global and board specific rules are in full effect. Apart from that, only two rules are important.

1. BE EXCELLENT TO EACH OTHER.
2. PARTY ON, DUDES. (AND DUDETTES)

[{'no': 87016603, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)05:56:43', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016189
>How fucked am I for choosing a model count this low?
Extremely low model count warbands can be strong with purposeful unit selection and a good understanding of how to play around your own low activation count. While the hero snake ladies are generally very strong, the non-hero snake ladies are either mediocre (melee ones) or unplayably bad (ranged ones) so I'm not so sure this particular elite build is going to give you great results.
>how are gloomspite gitz and rotbringers?
Gitz are incredibly flexible and very strong with their only real weakness being they don't have anything in-faction that can take a lot of punishment. They make for a fun glass-cannon kind of warband or you can bring in some allies or thralls to really round them out. It's pretty hard to go wrong with Gitz.
Pure Rotbringers aren't great but are at least better than last edition thanks to quite a few points decreases, the standard round length going from 3 to 4, and a decrease in deployments that have models coming in super late. They can be pretty decent if you're willing to bring in some allies though, the big thing they need is a mobile threat. Thralls are worth considering too as they fill an important role Rotbringers don't have access to natively; namely that they literally don't have any chaff.
>Really interested in rotbringers, what does a good team for them look like?
This list apparently got 10th place in a 30-some person event a couple weeks ago, so it's got to have some merit to it. Note how it has a fast killy ally and two movement buff models to help the blightkings get their fat asses across the board.

com:
>What is Exalted?
An epic high-flying role-playing game about reborn god-heroes in a world that turned on them.
Start here:http://theonyxpath.com/category/worlds/exalted/

>That sounds cool, how can I get into it?
Read the 3e core book (link below). For mechanics of the old edition, play this tutorial:http://mengtzu.github.io/exalted/sakuya.html
It’ll get you familiar with most of the mechanics.

>Gosh that was fun. How do I find a group?
Roll20 and the Game Finder General here on /tg/. good luck

com: We’ve got enough high fantasy threads, tell me about your World of Darkness/Delta Green style urban gothic settings.
last_replies:
[{'no': 87016660, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)06:07:20', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016444
I started a game set in one of the bigger cities in my country. Started out using Mummies, then added other splats. Before I knew it, I was running a Gonzo setting where different nightfolk were all involved in their own dramas and jockeying with each other for resources and ideological reasons, while humans blindly wander between committing their own atrocities. I now have a folder full of supporting cast members to go with my sourcebooks.

Something else I started doing was reading out a news bulletin at the start of each session, so players could stay abreast of mortal news and mortal developments, as well as general weird shit. That gives me a chance to foreshadow certain themes, introduce conditions that might complicate things for the players, or have B plots happening in the background.

I also use every Pentex subsidiary I can find mentioned online, but never mention Pentex.', 'time': 1670929640, 'resto': 87016444}, {'no': 87016922, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)06:53:51', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016444
I have four WoD settings, one each for Vampire, Werewolf, Mage and Wraith. My Wraith setting, Seattle Is Burning, is my favorite.

The name comes from the Great Seattle Fire of 1889, which burned 16 blocks of downtown Seattle to the ground with only 1 fatality. Those buildings now form the core of the Seattle Necropolis, giving it a very Victorian flair. Many of the leaders of the spectral community are famous city fathers, with the current leader being Doc Maynard. Other real world VIPs include David Sires, the first cop to die in Seattle (and head cop in the Necropolis); Kurt Cobain, who leads the Gray Legion (suicides) and has a huge cult of followers called the Cobainites; world champion motocross rider Jim Pomeroy, who is the PC's boss at the start of the game; hydroplane superstar Dean Chenoweth, who is their boss's boss in the eternal bureaucracy; and alt rocker/murder victim Mia Zapata, who is the leader of the radfem resistance group fighting Stygian patriarchy called the Dead Grrls.

The game is *mostly* about the PCs and their shit (i.e. their Shadows), but some plotlines that ran through the game were a rogue Technocracy mage whose gone full Ghostbusters, a conspiracy of Jade Empire agents who seek to establish a foothold in America via Seattle's huge Asian population, and the Dead Grrls ongoing attempts to overthrow Doc Maynard and bring the whole Necropolis down.', 'filename': 'Seattle is Burning cover', 'ext': '.png', 'w': 450, 'h': 583, 'tn_w': 96, 'tn_h': 125, 'tim': 1670932431733426, 'time': 1670932431, 'md5': 'ZfCZCqlgW67mtHcesu/RKA==', 'fsize': 607259, 'resto': 87016444}, {'no': 87017011, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)07:11:05', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016922
My other games are Reign (Vampire), Rage Across Montana (Werewolf), and Bound Below (Mage). The one sentence for each of those are:
>Reign (Solo): A fallen fashion model is drawn into the world of Lasombra politics when she is turned by the head of a Italian fashion house and trained as a vampire assassin.
>Rage Across Montana (Solo): A teenage girl in Butte, MT discovers that she's a werewolf, the Berkely Pit is a Wyrm-tainted Hellmouth, and fights against the Wyrm with the help of other teen monsters in this campaign HEAVILY influenced by Buffy the Vampire Slayer.
>Bound Below: When some mundane urban spellunkers accidentally open a sealed off temple under the heart of the city. There an ancient god was trapped halfway to materialization in the real world. A random group of mages is drawn to the location and realize they have discovered a massive source of Quintessence and form a chantry to defend it from the many, many forces that wish to claim it while unraveling the mystery of its origins.

Attached it the player intro document for Bound Below.', 'filename': 'Welcome to the Jungle', 'ext': '.pdf', 'w': 1, 'h': 1, 'tn_w': 96, 'tn_h': 124, 'tim': 1670933465420028, 'time': 1670933465, 'md5': 'J/WjqobktTBNGyoiMmKMjA==', 'fsize': 682743, 'resto': 87016444}]

>>87011775
>there is NO FUCKING WAY, Wizards would let NISEI profit off Garfield's game design
again I'm getting the feeling you're not really up on US copyright law or WotC's own legal history. there's never been a successful suit for infringing game design in a US court. WotC themselves have tried and *failed* to sue other companies for using mechanics from games, even fairly complete copies, that they published first. even MTG for which they not only had copyright claims, but for which RG filed multiple design patents in the early 90s.
the "but it's Richard Garfield's design!" angle isn't going to give their claim any real teeth. keep in mind - WotC is in court all the fucking time. This isn't for lack of trying. If they could sue all the other CCGs and RPGs that use "their" mechanics off the face of the planet they absolutely would have done that already.

And since they don't have design, what do they have? the name. the "concept" in some abstract sense (although much of that is really Pondsmith by way of Garfield). maybe some game terms, although doing anything with that 2 decades later is hard to imagine. most of the other enforceable IP isn't theirs, it's FFGs.

>The OGL license for 3.5 allowed someone to steal 3.5's "thunder"
yes, we all know what OGL is. but neither ONR, ANR or any of the Nisei stuff has ever been under OGL. it doesn't relate.

>MAYBE ONE IS LEGAL AND THE OTHER ISN'T!?
I can see those 15 years of law school were time well spent. your mom is probably very proud.
this is a civil issue, not a criminal one', 'time': 1670933348, 'resto': 86925087}]

name: Anonymous
com:
Welcome to the Old School Renaissance General, the thread dedicated to TSR-era D&D, derived systems, and compatible content.

Broadly, OSR games encourage a tonal and mechanical fidelity to Dungeons & Dragons as played in the game's first decade—less emphasis on linear adventures and overarching meta-plots and a greater emphasis on player agency.

If you are new to the OSR, welcome! Ask us whatever you're curious about: we'll be happy to help you get started.

>Resources, Blogs, etc:
http://pastebin.com/9fzM6128

>Need a starter dungeon? Here's a curated collection:
https://archive.4plebs.org/tg/thread/86342023/#q86358321

>Previous Thread:
>>86953587

>Thread question
How high in the power structure should be a dragon? Mid-tier giant lizard that breathes fire and dies to spear poking? Absolute top of the pile powerhouse that could crush anything in the world with one talon?

I remember one of the matrix books openly saying "yes a savvy decker will realize they could make enough money to retire in a month of decking (including time to fence stolen pay data) than they would from shadowrunning, just tell the player to go fuck themselves if they try that."', 'time': 1670930251, 'resto': 86973342}, {'no': 87016814, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)06:33:30', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87011743
How did they acquire world-leading skills as a diver without actual Swimming skills? Who taught them?

Skill substitution is a patch, and it isn't a good one when it prevents actual playability improvements. It's at least functional in GURPS, where you expect the important differences between Diving (earth-like) and Diving (Methane ocean planets) to be sufficiently similar to allow some crossover - and GURPS isn't shy of gating skills behind others... hence why it has like 300 skills with varying costs.

In Shadowrun, which barely needs 30 skills, Diving is at most a specialty of Swimming, even in subaqua games. It simply doesn't need any more than that for either genre trend. Parachuting shouldn't be split from Flying, Rappelling from Climbing, Kicking from Brawl, blah blah blah.', 'time': 1670931210, 'resto': 86973342}, {'no': 87016843, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)06:39:02', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87012350
Yes, this is true every edition. From 4E onwards there's also a layer of Idiotic Line Editor Meddling that fucks things up here and there, because he wants the last word and thinks you can just change numbers to feel right without game mechanical consequences.', 'time': 1670931542, 'resto': 86973342}, {'no': 87016950, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)06:58:34', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016714
Yeah, there's a constant struggle between "noooo, shadowrunners are poor murderhobos smoking cigarettes in the rain!" and "I can't hear you over the sound of my T-Bird lifting off". The former want payoffs to cause backstabs or dramatic death spirals ala Gibson, the latter to have payoffs start out appropriate to what their skills and the setting should produce.

Which wouldn't be an irreconcilable problem - as long as "steal millions in research" is paid more than "steal americars" for a basic degree of verisimilitude - but Mages and Adepts don't really care about money for character advancement, so they aren't hurt by poor payouts like Street Samurai and Riggers are. In fact the editions have gone through several methods of punishing Mages for caring about money.', 'time': 1670932714, 'resto': 86973342}, {'no': 87016986, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)07:05:43', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016950

[{'no': 87016243, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)04:52:06', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014105
Two types of elves. One is heavily inspired by Elezen, quick, strong and agile fighters but also with a talent for spellcasting. They have an ancient knightly martial tradition and long standing kingdoms on the main continent, but fall off a bit when it comes to recent technological development. They are also so well-mannered in every social situation that you can not respect them.
The other one is arguably more elf-like: magical fey-inspired people of somewhat plant-like, colorful complexion. Every individual is attuned to an element, which changes roughly every week and with that, their temperament and their character to some degree. That's not just fluff, there is a table for that. They also gain some bonuses for that element. After a while, they can settle for one and stop being schizophrenic. These live on garden-like islands and often follow some scholastic tradition.
There are no set subraces for any of them, but different smaller cultures for every island there is. If you roll up a desert-nomadic culture and then one of these elves as the main population: congrats, here, have your subrace. No need to give them mechanical representation though.', 'filename': 'dakaw4d-2747bf00-a3b2-4195-bbbf-eee354c96164', 'ext': '.jpg', 'w': 562, 'h': 1000, 'tn_w': 70, 'tn_h': 125, 'tim': 1670925126764685, 'time': 1670925126, 'md5': '3vpZeRVBf2eJg4c8nHhkFw==', 'fsize': 339281, 'resto': 86995322}, {'no': 87016310, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)05:05:26', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87000470
>>87000829

[{'no': 87015105, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:06:58', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015088

However, despite their maritime reputation, most Asvarans live on shore as farmers and herders, though neither is a major source of income at a national level. On the other hand, the azure diamond mining industry is nearly as important as the whaling industry, though it employs only a relatively small portion of the population. There have also been a few gold rushes, though there are no major mines at the moment.

>Foreign Relations:

Azan Empire – The Confederacy is still a part of the Empire, and still pays yearly tribute, though is politically very independent. No one in Azan cares too much though as long as the Confederacy remains a friendly port.

Azan Empire, Dsrvyth, Changrila, Blind Bastard’s Domain, Lorient – The main trading partners of the Confederacy.

Zulutaur Steppes – The Confederacy built a large wall to keep out inhabitants of Zulutaur Steppes, but also trade frequently with the Zulutaurs themselves and certain other friendly tribes. The wall is mostly for pig men, eight legged lions, ostrichfolk, orcs, and other hostile races and monsters living in the Steppes. An old Azanese canal that crosses a southern part of the Steppes and allows access to the Sea of the Void is heavily used by the Asvarans, though is officially not affiliated with any nation.

Mona Ki Ngi Xica Savannah – Major land trade routes cross this region to reach the Sea of Fog and from there the Domain. Asvarans are frequent visitors to ports on the west side of the Savannah run by the Domain, but rarely travel further east themselves.

Maneater Islands, Ortuga, Nasr Satrapies – Asvarans have a strong dislike for pirates, and are often targeted by them, though ironically, many pirates themselves are Asvaran.

Tuarapon – Occasionally Asvarans will visit to search for rare plants and animals.

War-Wel, Eldritch Jungle, the Maelstorm, and Moreaux Island – The Asvarans generally avoid these places.', 'filename': '2 - Asvaran Fishmonger', 'ext': '.jpg', 'w': 879, 'h': 1080, 'tn_w': 101, 'tn_h': 125, 'tim': 1670911618174657, 'time': 1670911618, 'md5': '6x80ZARbhX64LjjTW3LjeA==', 'fsize': 92853, 'resto': 86924239}, {'no': 87015116, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:08:41', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015105

>Geography:

The northern shore is subtropical, though large portions of it have been cleared for grazing land. The southern shore is cooled by a poorly understood ocean current, and has a temperate climate that seems positively frigid compared to the steaming jungles that ring the nearby Sea of The End. In between the two shores are a small but steep mountain range that is frequently covered in snow.

Azanese Heartland architecture tends to dominate in urban areas, but in rural areas buildings tend to be simpler structures of painted wood, half-timber, or stone.

>Demographics:

Human – Most of the population is human, but of several different ethnicities. The Diwi people are the original inhabitants, and despite partially assimilating into the dominant culture, still often wear traditional garb and keep live in separate villages, though they are common enough in cities and on ships as well. The settlers are often of Westerling origin from North Scimitaria, North Azan, Wanaidheain, etc., but some are also from south or west coast Azan Empire, Changrila, or a number of other places that were a part of the Azan Empire at the time. In more recent times, there has been some immigration from seafaring nations like Zapalovach or Hithlone.

Hobbits and dwarves – A few of these races settled the area alongside human settlers. The burrow style houses of the hobbits sometimes become local tourist attractions.

Orcs – A few orcs still live in the wilder parts of the Confederacy, though they are more common in the Zulutaur Steppes. Academics have yet to decide whether the west coast or the south coast of the continent is the original orc homeland, but now they can be found on both in certain areas.

Beast Races – Small tribes and raiding parties from the so-called beast races of the Zulutaur Steppe can sometimes be found in the Asvaran Confederacy including zulutaurs, ostrichfolk, man-beasts, and pig men.', 'filename': '3 - Typical Farmhouse', 'ext': '.jpg', 'w': 1920, 'h': 960, 'tn_w': 125, 'tn_h': 62, 'tim': 1670911721660217, 'time': 1670911721, 'md5': 'O/rcEUBKcf3RzyymtGHj8Q==', 'fsize': 401136, 'resto': 86924239}, {'no': 87015127, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:10:41', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015116

4>Religion:

The New Azan Faith is dominant in the Confederacy, though a few other religions can be found as well including the Northmen Pantheon, assorted Westerling faiths, the Divine Light, and Avestanianism.

Although most of the Diwi people have converted to the New Azan Faith, aspects of their old spirit worshipping religion still survive. Like certain other religions in the south, it doesn’t distinguish between gods, demons, fey, and spirit animals, seeing all as spirits to be placated, though certain regional spirits get most of the attention.

>Military:

During the initial colonization, the region was fairly dangerous, and as a result, most communities were walled. These days, only the large stone walls of certain older cities and towns still survive, as the region has largely been pacified except for the occasional pirate raid or harassment from beast races or orcs.

A large wall along the border of the Zulutaur Steppes helps keep most of the more feral beast races from easily entering the Confederacy.
Asvarans are too independent minded to maintain a large army, but there is an Azanese Legion, plus dedicated city watches and town guards in the larger communities. Most of the actual fighting gets done by the colonial militia regiments though. Often fighting as light cavalry, they are well adapted to the sunny hills and steppes where they often see action.

The Confederacy doesn’t have its own fleet, but Azanese Navy detachments sometimes deploy in the region, and the Asvarans have a reputation for heavily arming their merchant, whaling, and fishing vessels.', 'filename': '4 - Diwi Shaman', 'ext': '.jpg', 'w': 755, 'h': 1000, 'tn_w': 94, 'tn_h': 125, 'tim': 1670911841624260, 'time': 1670911841, 'md5': '5Z1aO3u00tnKLJkcB88GTQ==', 'fsize': 52391, 'resto': 86924239}, {'no': 87015155, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:16:19', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015074
Hard to say, in dnd goblins, hobgoblins, and bugbears are closely related.

In this setting, goblins and hobgoblins are sometime associated with the fey, and other times their own thing. So far there are no linkages between the fey and bugbears, but given the areas they live in it is definitely plausible.', 'time': 1670912179, 'resto': 86924239}, {'no': 87016976, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)07:03:09', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': 'I'll try to create a basic religion map to keep up with what areas of the map worship what gods', 'time': 1670932989, 'resto': 86924239}]

Yes. And yes.

name: Anonymous
com:
Vermin of valour edition
Previous thread: >>86941998

>What is /awg/?
A thread to talk about minis and games which fall between the cracks, or peoples' homebrew wargames. The >>>/tg/hwg thread doesn't entertain fantasy (for good reason) and the other threads are locked to more specific games.
This thread isn't tied to a game, a publisher, or a genre, let's just talk about fun wargames. Any scale, any genre, any company, any miniatures. Skirmishers welcome. Rules designers welcome.

>Examples of games that qualify
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_miniature_wargames
OnePageRules, Warzone, Mighty Armies, Warmachine & Hordes, Dragon Rampant, Oathmark, Mortal Gods, Kings of War, Firefight, Deadzone, Warpath, Frost/Stargrave, Hordes of the Things, Gaslands, Conquest, Songs of Blades and Heroes, Dark Age, Beyond the Gates of Antares, Malifaux, and anything else that doesn't necessarily have a dedicated thread.

>Places to get minis
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1D2DbNJ2mYAUxh5P9Pq9NZqS5tXHGn0i2JhZchEwbA2I/edit
https://www.dakkadakka.com/dakkaforum/posts/list/373197.page
Updates to the minis list are welcome.

>The Novice Troves
https://pastebin.com/MjtsC8AX
https://mega.nz/#F!zSYW0I4a!vXh8-UPi_tWXpJES_-p4zg
These troves are currently full, and meant to serve as a sampler of available systems. Check out the sharethread for more up-to-date troves

>Thread Theme
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XjvBP7JzbFM

>Thread Question
What are you working on at the moment?

[{'no': 87014378, 'now': '12/12/22(Mon)23:23:15', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87008350
>Chunk Hardpec
This thing is great.', 'time': 1670905395, 'resto': 86983856}, {'no': 87014709, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)00:18:00', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87010975
>There is just something so captivating and great about old miniatures made in the 1970s and early 1980s.
>P.s where do you get your old school miniatures?
Many of those companies are still in business, and a lot of the dead ones sold off their molds before they went. It's also not like those sculptors all just up and died.
Ral Partha Europe and Iron Wind Metals in the US (there was a corporate restructuring in the 2000s when FASA died) still sell literally thousands of their old Chaos Wars and D&D minis.
Mirliton Minis bought out Grenadier Miniatures.
Wargames Foundry was created by one of the original GW crew, and still carries hundreds of their models plus many more newer sculpts by the same guys.
Knightmare Minis is another old-school sculptor doing his own shit.
As always, Reaper has a whole bunch of great stuff tucked away in the ass end of their catalog. For example, this Bob Olley Marsh Troll that's a companion piece to the one you have in the upper right.
https://www.reapermini.com/search/olley/latest/02609
Bob also has his own site selling other models as well.', 'time': 1670908680, 'resto': 86983856}, {'no': 87015958, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)03:49:02', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87000206

>refluffing elves, dwarves and orcs as human factions
I'm not opposed to the idea. My main concern is that fantasy race factions tends to come with (and be balanced for) a certain amount of fantasy units which may not have an equivalent in our campaign setting.
But it's crazy how little options there are for Hyborian-age style Sword and Sorcery in wargames.
You would just need a few basic pseudo-historical archetypes:
>Heavy infantry phalanx, for the pseudo Greeks and Romans
>Horse archer, for the pseudo Scythian and Huns
>Undisciplined rabbles of barbarians footmen
>Legions of enslaved light infantry for the evil empires. Comes with the optional evil sorcerer.

com:
Slavic fantasy edition

Welcome to /wbg/, the official thread for the discussion of in-progress settings for traditional games.

Here is where you go to present and develop the details of your worlds such as lore, factions, magic and ecosystems. You can also post maps for your settings, as well as any relevant art (either created by you or used as inspiration for your work). Please remember that dialogue is what keeps the thread alive, not asking questions to OP every third hour.

Last Thread: >>86898658

Resources for Newfags: https://sites.google.com/view/wbgeneral/
Worldbuilding links: https://pastebin.com/JNnj79S5

Released in November 2017, Genesys is a pen-and-paper generic/universal RPG system and toolkit by Fantasy Flight Games and EDGE Studio, using a refined version of the system presented by their Star Wars RPGs (Edge of the Empire, Age of Rebellion, Force and Destiny). Its central mechanic is the Narrative Dice System, using pools made of specialized dice to create narrative results. The intention is for the system to be a highly flexible narrative system, adaptable to most any conceivable setting and premise.
https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/genesys/
https://edge-studio.net/

((LATEST NEWS))
>EDGE Studio is currently prioritizing digital releases so as not to be held up by more difficult physical releases
>"Twilight Imperium: Embers of the Imperium," a new space opera splat based on Twilight Imperium, is set to launch by the end of 2022
https://edge-studio.net/games/embers-of-the-imperium/
https://edge-studio.net/news-embers-of-the-imperium/
https://images-cdn.fantasyflightgames.com/filer_public/b6/d9/b6d969a2-21c2-4b1e-8d6f-ac6fec456b88/guide_to_the_imperium_10_web.pdf

>Where can I find the books?
Check the Online Extras pastebin below for something useless. The core book is the only mandatory book.

[{'no': 87016607, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)05:57:53', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016307
Back in the days of AD&D 2nd Edition Spelljammer, there were Lichs, Demi-Lichs and Arch-Lichs. Lichs were Evil mages or priests and had a phylactery. Demi-Lichs were just a skull in a box with gemstone teeth. But Arch-Lichs were typically Good mages, priests or bards that had created a functional magical item in lieu of a phylactery and embraced undeath for less selfish reasons. They were pretty mellow, lonely, and had sparkling white lights in their empty eye sockets.

I always worked with the assumption that most if not all businesses in Five Nations and their offshoots are at least aligned with and certified by House-led guilds.', 'time': 1670928391, 'resto': 86999120}, {'no': 87016768, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)06:24:32', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016527

"Most" does not mean "all." In my opinion, the most concise description of this state of affairs comes from the Eberron Campaign Guide, pp. 208, 209:

>Unity and Wealth: These two elements are related. The dragon marked families were drawn together by their marks. This unifying factor (along with the mystical powers of the marks) gave these early guilds a competitive edge over independent artisans, and so they prospered. Over the centuries, each house has become quite wealthy, and many of them have used this wealth to eliminate rivals. House Cannith doesn’t care about a single independent blacksmith in Wroat. But if that smith somehow began producing warforged or remarkable magical goods and refused to join the Cannith guild, there’s a good chance that the house would arrange to have the smith eliminated, whether through a smear campaign or by hiring Thuranni assassins.

>Training: After centuries of consolidation, most major trade schools are run by the dragon marked houses. An apprentice agrees to serve in a house guild in exchange for training—thus strengthening the control of the house guild over that trade.

>Industry Standards: Whether it denotes a licensed business or a direct arm of the house, a guild seal promises a certain level of quality that the people of Khorvaire have come to rely upon. This is reflected by the standards for goods set down in the Player’s Handbook. A sunrod made to House Cannith specifications burns for 4 hours and costs 2 gp. If you go to an unlicensed alchemist, you might be able to get a sunrod at half the price—but it might last for half the expected time, or might not work at all. Of course, an unlicensed business could also exceed guild standards: There’s no way to know.', 'filename': '527e3834b5dee12590aeab33c78db4c1', 'ext': '.jpg', 'w': 2000, 'h': 2829, 'tn_w': 88, 'tn_h': 125, 'tim': 1670930672621726, 'time': 1670930672, 'md5': 'ilIw3BBVmPAmNZMMTnvrTg==', 'fsize': 458987, 'resto': 86999120}, {'no': 87016776, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)06:25:42', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016768

>It is important to understand that beyond the dragonmarks themselves, the influence of the houses is derived from over a thousand years of work—product development, propaganda, and the elimination of rivals. The houses have helped shape the modern world, developing rituals and techniques now taken for granted. Although the houses are neither omnipotent nor omnipresent, it’s always worth considering whether a business is a house arm, licensed by the house, or independent—and if it’s independent, whether it meets the standards people have come to expect, and what the cost might be for doing business with it.', 'filename': '54a792cfc3111f39e7993bfd8254257d', 'ext': '.png', 'w': 3440, 'h': 2652, 'tn_w': 125, 'tn_h': 96, 'tim': 1670930742349333, 'time': 1670930742, 'md5': 'DushdomS56VRfNRuNlhoUQ==', 'fsize': 4873663, 'resto': 86999120}, {'no': 87016789, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)06:27:56', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016776

For example, in a major city of the Five Nations, most blacksmiths will be affiliated with House Cannith in some way. They probably graduated from a Cannith trade school as a magewright, and even if they did not, they are likely Cannith-certified (and required to pay a cut to the gorgon).

But there will always be a significant number of independents. A customer purchasing goods from a non-Cannith-certified blacksmith does not know what they are getting. If the customer buys a cheap sword, it might be a fantastic deal, or it might be brittle junk. Independent blacksmiths have no Cannith diploma, no seal of approval, no seal of quality. Given a choice between a Cannith blacksmith and an independent, a customer looking for a reliable product with a consistent price will buy from the former. Independents face an uphill battle.

Even if an independent blacksmith does distinguish themselves, they will likely be targeted by Cannith for recruitment. Should the independent refuse, they may mysteriously suffer unfortunate damage to their reputation or their health. Some talented independents are effectively untouchable; Tanar Mendyrian (Sharn: City of Towers, p. 80) carries the prestigious Mendyrian name, and would be supported by many Aereni. Other legendary independents, such as Golan Dol ( http://www.bossythecow.com/Golan%20Dol.pdf ), are currently recluses who do not economically threaten House Cannith.

There is, of course, another option for independents: the Aurum. One of the organization's missions is to dethrone the dragonmarked houses as Khorvaire's leaders of industry, and they would surely be happy to support independents.

https://keith-baker.com/dragonmarks-the-aurum/
https://5e.tools/book.html#erlw,9,the%20aurum

This is a general for everything 3D printed relating to /tg/ from sci-fi, fantasy, historicals, fantasy football, and more! Share your printed minis, terrain, print fails, 3d modeling, printing advice, works in progress, or anything else /tg/-related to 3D printing.

>DO:
- Post pics of your prints be they fails or triumphs
- Keep your prints and files about tabletop games only
- Encrypt file links
- Use Passwords
- Post your resin/printer/settings for faster advice
- Help your fellow anons with advice

>TRY TO:
- Not make a new thread until old one dies
- Not encourage namefags, tripfags, fumefags and coomers
- Not spoonfeed newfags
- Not encrypt links to websites
- Not discuss encryption/passwords
- Keep your model pics naked (no paint/undercoat only)
- Look after small artists/studios
- Buy something from or tip an artist/studio you like
- Read the last 3 threads before posting

>special note here, there are some throwaway lines that indicate that its not always people, including one mention of a creature with the bottom part of a scorpion and the top half of a gorilla
Originally the scorpion goddess Bagog constantly ate things and after getting infected by Chaos her children would as a result bear physical resemblances to what was devoured. So you'd have scorpion-lions, scorpion-cows and so forth. Out of all of these hybrids only the scorpionmen managed to survive on their own until modern time. I guess there's no reason scorpion queens couldn't do the same with other animals. But they're probably not as useful as regular scorpionmen.

As for more monsters we of course have the iconic Crimson Bat. A kaiju sized demonic bat that's used as an attack animal by the Lunar empire. Its eyes can view into other planes, it belches acid clouds and its blood drains the life force of anything that touches it. It requires a constant supply of human sacrifice to not go on a rampage.', 'filename': 'cory-trego-erdner-crimson-bat-02', 'ext': '.jpg', 'w': 1920, 'h': 2425, 'tn_w': 98, 'tn_h': 125, 'tim': 1670930556193653, 'time': 1670930556, 'md5': 'BvcRolvUiaHOve/u4rODDQ==', 'fsize': 544586, 'resto': 86902302}]

name: Anonymous
com:
previous thread: >>86804700

<<<<<<<< READ THE PDF BEFORE ASKING WHERE TO START

GURPS is a modular, adaptable system, capable of running a wide range of characters, settings, and play styles with level of detail varying from lightweight to completely autistic.
Optional rules allow you to emulate different genres with a single system, even switching genres within a single game.

A nearly complete archive of GURPS books can be found by those who pay attention to file extensions.
Never post direct links to the archive anywhere.

If you're wondering where to start:
The Basic Set covers everything, including a lot of optional rules you probably won't use.
A genre guide can be found in the archive, under Unofficial > GURPSgen. It tells you what extra books and articles you may find useful for many common genres.
How To be a GURPS GM is a good read even for players.
GCS (gurpscharactersheet.com) is an excellent character builder software with page references to all the books and the option to export to both Foundry and Fantasy Grounds.

TQ: Will AI art really save GURPS artwork problem?

[{'no': 87015985, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)03:54:22', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014251
I describe his death, then continue the game with the other players because a hissy fit is not a solution.
After the game we can discuss the issue and if he can build a reasonable argument we can work things out, especially if other players support him. In any other case he can leave the table.', 'time': 1670921662, 'resto': 87014251}, {'no': 87016694, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)06:14:03', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014251

I'm not obliged to avoid "railroading" to enable something being a shithead on purpose.
If he has a genuine reason in-character, sure, he can do this.

name: Anonymous
com:
>>>DRAWTHREAD RULES<<<

>Requesters:
• Provide good, detailed references (pictures are better than verbal descriptions), so the artists know what you're looking for.
• Only bump your request once every 24 hours. Don't bump WIPs.
• If you have a WIP quote the Anchor Post, and attach the WIP so your drawfag can find you.
• Do not reply to other deliveries with a request that the artist fill your request next, this is called 'piggybacking'.
• Do not make multiple requests in the same thread and do not serially request multiple characters after a delivery. Suggesting several concepts for artists to choose from counts as making multiple requests.
• If you're unsatisfied with your completed request, please wait at least one week before you re-request. If someone follows this rule, don't waste posts by complaining about it.
• Reminder that nobody is entitled to a delivery under any circumstances within these threads. Don't critique others' requests. If you don't like it, don't draw it.
• Stay on topic. This thread has been deleted twice!

>Artists and Artists-to-Be:
• Feel free to drop your tumblrs/websites/commission/etc information, but if you're dropping your commission info, please consider filling a request beforehand instead of just advertising.

Any love for MCP on /tg/? I don't think I've ever seen a thread or general about it.

It's currently my main miniature wargame after Warmachine died in my area and am having good fun with it. The low model count, simple yet broad rules, and mostly great sculpts across the board would be my main selling points.

What affiliations do you play, anon? I've played Avengers with various add-ins since I started, and more recently adding Winter Guard into the mix.

[{'no': 87010980, 'now': '12/12/22(Mon)17:37:19', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87008036
I see what the scenarios are, then build a core that reaches Affiliation requirements, and splash in a character or two to even things out.
>Green Goblin to lead affiliation and cause trouble

>Lizard or Venom for a tanky bruiser
>Mysterio or Doc Oc to round things out

People who wanted Norman Osborne as their leader character. Sinister Six was always more of an Otto thing. Plus not everybody has had a go on that team. Scorpion for instance. I don't think Hobgoblin was either, but I could be wrong. Carnage definitely isn't a team player.
They also kind of fucked themselves over by putting Otto in the core box because they needed a spiderman villain in there, and as a result he doesn't have a Leadership ability, and whilst since that they've seemed more willing to just reprint characters from the core box in new formats formats (Amazing Spiderman, WW2 Cap, Hydra Red Skull etc) they're dragging their feet with Otto.', 'time': 1670925702, 'resto': 86998274}, {'no': 87016388, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)05:22:40', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>86998274

Spellcaster edition
TQ - Arcane or Divine magic?
last_replies:
[{'no': 87012450, 'now': '12/12/22(Mon)19:59:07', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>86980644
Less of a “Magic-Mart (tm),” situation and more of an “antiques and art dealer” situation for powerful magic items. They aren’t impossible to obtain, but many of them are relics from ancient empires and aren’t readily available. Rich NPCs might be after them strictly for their value as collectibles and art pieces. Networking with NPCs is required to get what you want or offload expensive items that you don’t need (and my NPCs WILL try to fuck you out of a fair deal).

Less powerful magic items can generally be procured from an enchanter in a major city though.

I also try to steer players towards stronghold building and purchasing of services as an alternate outlet for gold.', 'time': 1670893147, 'resto': 86969440}, {'no': 87014946, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)00:46:49', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': 'How do you find a 3.5 table in the modern day?', 'time': 1670910409, 'resto': 86969440}, {'no': 87016025, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)04:01:25', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014946
Know someone who wants to run a game and knows enough people interested in it to get everyone together.
You could use roll20 game finder if you're desperate, you might get lucky and meet with at least enough sane people you can get along with to get one game functioning.', 'time': 1670922085, 'resto': 86969440}, {'no': 87016166, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)04:32:26', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014946
You reach out to gamers you know or social media groups you're in and advertise an interesting campaign, or keep an eye out for people doing the same. Maybe also look for or start an open table.', 'time': 1670923946, 'resto': 86969440}, {'no': 87016583, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)05:54:02', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016166
But your best bet is to GM one, as this will introduce you to a bunch of people who like the system.
There are some good JA posts about the benefits of open tables and how to run them. It could help you develop a network of gamers with similar tastes.

If you join the facebook groups about 3e or forgotten realms, they may also be good places to look. FR fans tend towards hating the post 2008 stuff for what wizards did to the thing we like, and it tends to be a mix of ad&d / 2e / 3e / 3e + pf1 players.', 'time': 1670928842, 'resto': 86969440}]

name: Anonymous
com: The Dark Lords wins in your fantasy setting. Elves and Dwarves are now extinct, Magic has been banned and it's practitioners killed, Orcs sack your town, and Tieflings get lynched. What happens?
last_replies:
[{'no': 87015151, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:15:29', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87012926
I remember seeing this some time back, thought it was intriguing.', 'time': 1670912129, 'resto': 86994747}, {'no': 87015254, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:36:11', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>86994747
Dark Lords? So what does the Local Dark Lord do?', 'time': 1670913371, 'resto': 86994747}, {'no': 87015670, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)02:58:15', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015254
Serves the Dark Duke who then serves the Dark Praetor who're directly installed by the Dark Emperor to rule over his territories. Things then get complicated when you factor in the the Dark colonial governors, the Dark Army, the Dark Imperial Guard, the Dark Admiralty Board, and the Dark Prime Minister. Her Dad was a lumberjack, a man who chopped down trees, and they moved away from the big scary city.
>She wanted to be like him, so she picked up little sticks so they had more wood. Mom would put it in the fireplace, which would warm up their little house made of logs. Her Mom would then sit her in her lap and tell her stories while Dad and Jon talked about stupid grown up things.
>"Long ago, this was the home of the Elves. Terrible things who'd eat each other and kidnap children to boil in pies. They'd string candy in trees, bait to lure children away from home. Then they take them to Elf Land, strung up and fattened like pigs before boiled alive in a massive pot pie."
>"What happened to them?" She asked as she watched the flames cackle, their stub tailed cat sitting alongside them.
>"They ate a Prince which angered a King. He came with all the King's Horses and all the King's Men, and they burned Elf Land. All the ash and soot went into the air, covering the sun. Now it's Winter evermore."
>Amber thought on her Mom's words. She liked her Mom, her stories of wonder and dread. She continued through the forest, found some sticks but she saw something tied to the branch of the pine tree. It was a cupcake, with red and blue sprinkles and white frosting.
>"I shouldn't," Amber got closer and closer as her stomach started growling, "But..." Her small hands gently clasped the sweet, untying the string. The branch began shaking and Amber could only scream. Her parents found nothing.
>But many months later, they found a meat pie on their doorstep.', 'filename': '360_F_321607144_e0dnqrWJYkg8HNSfehxTFwFGJpKvalu5', 'ext': '.jpg', 'w': 640, 'h': 360, 'tn_w': 125, 'tn_h': 70, 'tim': 1670928157902712, 'time': 1670928157, 'md5': 'DFaMcV8ve5x8RS8cyZ1NWQ==', 'fsize': 44758, 'resto': 86994747}]

name: Anonymous
com:
What would a pantheon based on the different stages of human development be like? How would the gods differ by gender?

>god of infanthood
>god of toddlerhood
>god of childhood
>god of adolescence
>god of adulthood
>god of middle age
>god of geriatrics
last_replies:
[{'no': 87016143, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)04:27:02', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015573
Well... I mean technically a lot pantheons are already like that. For example in Greek:
>Father/King (Zeus)
>Mother/Queen (Hera)
>Sons (Hermes, Ares, etc.)
>Daughters (Athena, Penelope, etc)
>The previous generation: Cronous & Rhea
>The previous previous generation: Uranus & Gaia

If you look at it zoomed out, the Greek Pantheon's cycle is basically is sons (who was hidden away by the mother) ousting their fathers for the throne. Whether this is metaphorical allegory of ancient history's violence, or perhaps a warning against immortality where the fathers never leave power; it still shows us a certain human development cycle if you look at the whole thing.', 'time': 1670923622, 'resto': 87015573}, {'no': 87016201, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)04:42:42', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016143
The Titans (Cronus, etc.) are the gods of "pre-Greek" Greece, and their conflict with the Olympians is a representation of the Indo-European proto-Greeks supplanting an older culture of the southern Balkans.

You see something similar with Germanic mythology's Aesir and Vanir, except that they established a concordance, meaning the Indo-European invaders initially fought, but then merged with the earlier society of Scandinavia, rather than overthrowing it.', 'time': 1670924562, 'resto': 87015573}, {'no': 87016287, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)05:00:58', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016143
>>87016201
Not familial roles, but stages of life', 'time': 1670925658, 'resto': 87015573}, {'no': 87016410, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)05:27:20', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015573
There's already pantheons like this. Some neopagans worship three-fold aspects of the maiden, mother, and crone for example.', 'filename': 'Three Faces of Eve', 'ext': '.png', 'w': 697, 'h': 1024, 'tn_w': 85, 'tn_h': 125, 'tim': 1670927240580903, 'time': 1670927240, 'md5': 'G/wWUiXfwk7U3c9lQyTdXw==', 'fsize': 1450128, 'resto': 87015573}, {'no': 87016423, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)05:29:19', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87016287
It is a stage of life (in the form of familial roles). In the Greek mythology's mindset a boy will eventually oust his father, and the father will try to kill his son. Thus the boy's destiny is from toddler get protected from mother from the father; in childhood train to become stronger than father; in adulthood oust his father; and than become paranoid of his son (and maybe wife?) later in life. Represented by each generation of gods and the context they play within the mythos.

Why do Zeus cheats on Hera and make "illegitimate" children 24/7?
Why does he trust daughter Athena a lot in many versions of myths, but not really his sons?
Why are a lot the sons have traits/skills that are good for assassinations (Hermes especially)?

I'm not saying that the Greeks thought these were good traits for a man to emulate, but probably there are allegories that represents what a man was expected to brace for becoming an adult and then elderly.', 'time': 1670927359, 'resto': 87015573}]

name: Anonymous
com:
Is it bad for a tabletop RPG to have PC stats like Attack, Defence, Movement, Movement etc. that directly reference mechanics instead of more general descriptions like Strength and Charisma? If so, why?
I'm writing a system and I'm really not sure if I want mental/social stats to be a mechanical thing instead of just roleplaying them. So it seems like only traits relevant to combat and technical skills really need accounting.
last_replies:
[{'no': 87011598, 'now': '12/12/22(Mon)18:36:36', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>86995936
Giving the PCs "attack" instead of strength leaves me mechanically unsupported for doing literally anything with my muscles except murdering. Giving me only metrics for killing leaves me with a system that only has my back when arbitrating murder.
I get that approach but it's not for me, I like having something mechanical to fall back on when I want to let a die decide when the outcome is in doubt, and given the option I will take something with consistent design in that regard. It's not like I need to make my players roll for everything or have separate defined stats for every situation but I like having a framework to improvise with. What you are proposing to me sounds like a weird take on storygames, where the rules are super prescriptive about one thing and don't exist for anything else. I enjoy those games sometimes, but they aren't my go to.
In my experience my players will ALWAYS think of something. Sure I can improvise, but having a consistent mechanical underpinning is my preference.', 'time': 1670888196, 'resto': 86995936}, {'no': 87015130, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:11:21', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87011503
I have mechanics and lore to encourage roleplay, they're just not roll-based. I do not think rolling for persuasion is engaging RP.', 'time': 1670911881, 'resto': 86995936}, {'no': 87015729, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)03:09:17', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015130
So you have a tactical skirmish war game interspersed with freeform story telling. Neat idea but don’t call it a TTRPG', 'time': 1670918957, 'resto': 86995936}, {'no': 87015737, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)03:10:34', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87005368
It's not roleplaying if your character sheet is doing it for you, m8. So called 'social' stats are absurd.', 'time': 1670919034, 'resto': 86995936}, {'no': 87016412, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)05:27:53', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015729
>So you have a tactical skirmish war game
There's no grid for it to qualify as tactical. And wargames don't have sandbox exploration, which is a bigger focus than combat.
>interspersed with freeform story telling
Aka roleplaying. In a game. Making it a roleplaying game.', 'time': 1670927273, 'resto': 86995936}]

last_replies:
[{'no': 87014784, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)00:28:05', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>86995615
>campaign is amazing, but DM didn't screen for time zones, and so you get maybe two posts a night as the player in australia and the player in europe slowly hash through their conversation
>campaign is amazing, until the player you had the most chemistry with drops out and it's just meh
>campaign is amazing, until the DM turns out to be incredibly attached to their NPCs and takes things personally if you're mean to them
>campaign is amazing, but the DM lowballs the difficulty and there's hardly any ERP
Most of these problems are more problems with text games then problems with ERP campaigns specifically, but It keeps happening.', 'filename': 'KaosAaAhhHHH', 'ext': '.jpg', 'w': 1280, 'h': 720, 'tn_w': 125, 'tn_h': 70, 'tim': 1670909285636463, 'time': 1670909285, 'md5': 'uuy6IWTCpPjH9kfvIFEPLg==', 'fsize': 373004, 'resto': 86965956}, {'no': 87015100, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:06:26', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': 'I've never had any of those problems except the last one, and I play lewd and nonlewd text games a lot.
I'm also in australia but I just don't join play by post games, it's not too hard to match up with weekend games in america by waking up a bit early.
Admittedly #2 sounds more like 'player is amazing' than 'campaign is amazing' though.

Biggest problem I see in text games is when the pacing isn't managed properly and every scene goes on 10 minutes longer than it should because every conversation gets RP'd out in full (as opposed to the GM just saying "you ask for directions and they tell you and you move on") and sometimes no player wants to be rude and say 'this scene feels over, let's move on'.', 'time': 1670911586, 'resto': 86965956}, {'no': 87015119, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:09:24', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014784
What does it mean to lowball difficulty?', 'time': 1670911764, 'resto': 86965956}, {'no': 87015150, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:15:27', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87013136
That's what I'm saying, when you have no way of knowing, you shouldn't filter critique based off your assumptions of whether they're sincere enough, and it goes both ways: if you think people are going to read the rules and make up feedback just to make your game worse, then nothing will stop them from phrasing it politely and acting like a big supporter just to disguise the fact they want to fuck you over.
The best you can do is dissociate feedback from tone and evaluate it fairly to see whether the reasoning is sound or not.

Remember, feedback already goes through a filter: people not complaining about something could mean it's fine, or it could mean nobody used that particular rule because they thought it was boring, or that lots of people had problems with it and dropped it without giving feedback.', 'time': 1670912127, 'resto': 86965956}, {'no': 87016326, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)05:08:08', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015150
Another thing you have to watch out for with feedback is sometimes people will complain about a thing and not have the insight on what the real issue is. Their perception may be off based on their experiences or knowledge or whatever. So when you consider advice you have to evaluate what it is that is causing whatever issues that make them want to complain or give advice on how to make things "better."', 'time': 1670926088, 'resto': 86965956}]

name: Notepad Anon
com:
It's a Holy Jolly December, can we ever be redeemed? Welcome to the December thread of homebrew discussion on /tg/. This is part of my effort to get people discussing classic homebrew discussion and assist the board in general when it comes to their game design endeavors.

>Who is this namefaggot?
I'm just a dude who writes games and likes the homebrew discussions on /tg/. I frequent a few threads, but I'm just here to facilitate discussion. I was [BusinessMaxxing] in the UK last month, I'm back and scored some fackin' goals.

>Why should I homebrew?
/tg/ products are fairly unique in that it's actually pretty simple to make them these days, with a plethora of products to assist in making and playtesting your game. Making your own games helps understand why games are made the way they are, as well as being fun to do.

>What you should post
Ideas for games, games you're currently making, updates to your own games in broad strokes, and any homebrewing for existing products that don't get much attention. Discussion about the above is welcome. Post good, be good, and look over others products, they care if someone looks more than anything.

>Oh No! The Thread is Over!
Have no fear, the thread will resume at the first of every month. If you want to make another during the month, go for it. I can't, and won't, stop you. If you want to make a thread on your own game, go for it!
One suggestion: Don't add General to the name. Mid-Month Threads are "relatively" common.

>Resources for the aspiring developer
>https://anydice.com/ (A fantastic resource for checking probabilities)
>https://miro.com/ (A online whiteboard with tools to help organize yourself)
>https://www.notion.so/ (Similar to the above, but in a bit cleaner format for those who work in larger teams)
>https://rolz.org/ (Impromptu playtesting at its finest)
>https://www.youtube.com/user/georgephillies/playlists (Game Design Lectures)

Thanks for taking the time to check it out!', 'time': 1670925244, 'resto': 86896333}, {'no': 87016254, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)04:54:28', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': 'Ok I got some great ideas from these anons >>87014048 & >>87014977 . I have a rough idea for a initiative and combat system that might work well for my game. Which do people think would work better? In both all creatures have somewhere between 15-20 Action Points to determine who goes first and what actions they can take. Ties go to the players unless a Arc Villain is in the scene, then they go first. The goal of this system is to have dynamic and reactive combat mirroring a anime fight or the editing of a AMV.
>Option A
Combat starts at it’s a initiative count equal to the highest AP on the board and counts down. All actions have a cost depending on complexity. Movement is 1 AP, attacks are 3+ depending on power and complexity, etc. Actions are determined when the initiative count reaches your current AP and don’t occur until the initiative equals your AP again. So you have 10 AP and decide to move, that happens at initiative 9, so pretty much immediately. Once initiative 9 roles around you decide to attack, your AP becomes 6 but the attack doesn’t happen until initiative reaches 6 again. This assumes that enemies in your range have some mechanical reason to not move out of the way which I need to figure out. The attack can have its trajectory changed and you can choose to put it off to initiative 5 to move before the attack goes off.
>Option B
The same as above but the attack happens immediately and you can’t act again until X unitive counts have passed.
>Pros and Cons
Option B feels easier but option A gives the option to see and react to a attack winding up and getting ready to go off. And if you can choose to put off the attack any number of turns after you’ve “payed the cost” by moving to a target or something. Then even if they run away you can reposition and hit them. It definitely incentivize long range and wide AOEs. I should probably make range the deciding factor in AP cost if I go with option A.

Thoughts? Which sounds better to play?', 'filename': 'D77B6C4A-D07C-4046-B9E3-58FCF81B5466', 'ext': '.jpg', 'w': 1284, 'h': 928, 'tn_w': 125, 'tn_h': 90, 'tim': 1670925268552312, 'time': 1670925268, 'md5': 'oA+ndPooH9035KJOfWOGxw==', 'fsize': 877525, 'resto': 86896333}]

name: Chronicler
com:
Writing General: 'Fanfiction' edition.

Welcome to /wg/, the thread for all /tg/ related writing. Whether you're plotting your campaign, trying to come up with a character backstory, or just trying to write some setting fluff, this is the place to post it. You don't even have a campaign, just an idea you want to develop? You're welcome here. While the rest of /tg/ is arguing over mostergirl mating and which way rivers are supposed to flow, we're here to help you turn your thoughts into an actual finished product.

As the successor to the Storythreads, we're also open to /tg/ related fanfiction (D&D, Warhammer, Battletech, whatever). In fact, if you've written any vaguely /tg/-related short stories, you can try them out here. We also have flash-fiction challenges from time to time.

There's a discord for writers here
https://discord.gg/6AwKHGF

The previous thread can still be found in the archive here
>>86799881

And finally an archive of /tg/ fiction can be found here:
http://1d4chan.org/wiki/Storythread

name: Anonymous
com:
Hey there, everyone; how's it going? I've been working on a game called COGS over the past couple of years (a small number of people may even already know of it from a few threads I've posted it in). Yesterday, I launched a Kickstarter for it at https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/scribblegs/cogs-expanded-edition to fund a physical release filled with artwork and more supplemental material. It's got a small goal compared to some projects I've seen for FUCKING 5E SUPPLEMENTS, and a good chunk of the funding will probably go toward shipping and printing costs before anything else. However, I would appreciate any help that my fellow fa/tg/uys can provide by backing or spreading the word to people they feel might be interested.

>fuck your shill thread, faggot
Now I've been on /tg/ for a couple of years now; I perfectly get being mad about a shill thread and won't really object if I get called a faggot for it. However, I want to make clear that I would personally rather shill on 4chan and get called a fag than ever set foot on the unholy trash fire known as reddit.

>So where's the game then, gayboy?
I'm not a psychopath, don't worry. There is a free (or, well, PWYW at the moment) version of the game available on both DTRPG and itch.io at https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/382321/COGS--Generic-Oneshot-Generala-System and https://scribblegs.itch.io/cogs, respectively. Unfortunately, the text is still choppy at times since I'm a single amateur writer with no editor. However, the plan for the free versions, whether the Kickstarter succeeds or fails, is to update them to match the expanded edition and make them entirely free (not PWYW). They would become the "basic" game version, with no artwork and little supplemental content (like character creation tips, example content, or establishing expected power levels). However, it would still feature what rules and extra content they already have (which is already enough to play a game).

1/2

last_replies:
[{'no': 87010969, 'now': '12/12/22(Mon)17:35:47', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87010908
Depends on the system but most:
>Group tinies into a mob/crowd/unit
>Make bigun into a goal oriented milestones (i.e. Dungeon, Organization, etc) to be conquered.', 'time': 1670884547, 'resto': 87010908}, {'no': 87011030, 'now': '12/12/22(Mon)17:41:35', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87010908
I've had some success running very large enemies by using the enviromental hazard rules rather than the creature rules.', 'time': 1670884895, 'resto': 87010908}, {'no': 87012190, 'now': '12/12/22(Mon)19:35:51', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87010908
I prefer to have the smallest entities around three to five feet, while the largest are no bigger than twenty feet.
Every creature/active entity gets its own turn with an economy of action points, rather than the typical main/move/bonus setup.
Large entities, in exchange for having more costly actions, have both higher health and greater damage reduction than smaller entities.', 'time': 1670891751, 'resto': 87010908}, {'no': 87015578, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)02:40:26', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87010908
Have you tried... reading multiple RPG systems? It was really nice of >>87010969 to summarize, but you will have trouble grokking the ideas if you don't read them yourself.

Maybe look at Scion 2e for their "Scale" trait, or how FFG Star Wars handles "Minion Groups," or certain DnD/Pathfinder modules where a titanic critter is as much terrain as opponent.', 'time': 1670917226, 'resto': 87010908}, {'no': 87016092, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)04:14:00', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87010908
Use math.

Work out percentages of success and apply the results instead of rolling? IE, If 200 mooks all fire arrows at the plate wearing hero - say they each need a 20 to hit (on a d20), so thats 5% hit rate. 5% of 200 is 10 hits. So you haven't actually read the paladin's code, have you?

>Additionally, a paladin’s code requires that she respect legitimate authority, act with honor (not lying, not cheating, not using poison, and so forth), help those in need (provided they do not use the help for evil or chaotic ends), and punish those who harm or threaten innocents.

Paladins are required to protect the innocent. They are not required to punish the wicked. They are required to stop evil from harming others, not to kill evil simply for being evil.

However innately evil succubi might be, D&D provides ample example of even creatures literally composed of one alignment, switching to another alignment. A paladin absolutely could find two succubi who express genuine love for each other and recognize that love as a potential seed to try and help the succubi become Good.

The Book of Exalted Deeds says up front that it's not just a book about being good, but about being GOOD. It also states outright that helping evil find Redemption is pretty much the highest expression of Exalted Goodness that there is.

So the short version of what I'm saying is you're a moron, who doesn't read the book he's mocking, doesn't understand the class he's judging, and doesn't understand what it means to be truly Good.', 'time': 1670908490, 'resto': 86994989}, {'no': 87015172, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:19:39', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014690

Nothing kinky, Antifa or Nazi aligned, not in a cult and only mildly based and religious.

Anon let me make your year. Just bring me refreshments and some new weathering supplies or decent matt varnish spray, out of politeness.

Merry Christmas. Will not give to reseller. Will only give to poor gamer anons who will share with his friends.

Lastyearanon knows I am fr fr

name: Anonymous
com: I have an idea in mind for a modern campaign in which the p.c.s are combat specialists that act as mercenaries in foreign engagements. Some of the qualities I need is a comprehensive but fluid system that has detailed mechanics for guns and other military technologies. What system should I use?
last_replies:
[{'no': 87015431, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)02:11:35', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': 'Honestly, Only War is a good place to start. Just clamp down on all the magical bullshit, rename most of the guns and kill the corruption/insanity mechanics and you've got a decent enough simulation of modern firefights.

I've heard good things about Delta Green, but don't know shit about it.', 'time': 1670915495, 'resto': 87015411}, {'no': 87015445, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)02:13:44', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015411
GURPS, it has a lot of material and resources related to this subject matter.', 'time': 1670915624, 'resto': 87015411}, {'no': 87015973, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)03:51:17', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015431
>Only War
Came here to post this.
>GURPS
It has a tactical shooting dedicated book, but compared to Only War I'd say it's less fluid, then again, OP asked for detailed mechanics so it might be worth checking out.', 'time': 1670921477, 'resto': 87015411}, {'no': 87015983, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)03:53:44', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015411
Depends on largely what you want in that theme; you might want to check out:
>Combat: Only War (modded as it's 40k), Cyberpunk 2000 2ed (modded as it's near future), Delta Green (no need for mods, although you want to skimp the mythos/supernatural elements), Spycraft (no mods, but it's OGL/D&D 3.0~3.5)
>Tone/Setting: Various GURPS splats (nothing really beats Steve Jackson research... although it bit 20+ years old... please print 5th ed).
>Logistics and survival: Original Twilight 2000 or the new edition from Free League/Fria Ligan.', 'time': 1670921624, 'resto': 87015411}]

com:
How do you you make gods in your worlds?
What type of pantheon do your prefer? monotheistic, dualistic, polytheist?
If there are multiple gods how are their relation to one another? family like, rivalry, open war, or just don't care?
Are your gods a presence in everyday life or just the thing of speculation and legend?
Do each race in your world worship their own god or are gods something that is beyond race?
What does your gods represent? something abstract like good, evil, order, chaos or something more grounded like war, smiting, agriculture?
last_replies:
[{'no': 87007062, 'now': '12/12/22(Mon)09:51:44', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>86918177
I built a concept surrounding both gods and the races existing in a feedback loop. Originally the primordial world was seething with magic and gigantic monsters. Primeval man couldn't utilize this magic on their own and entered into pacts with primitive spirits of the world. Their souls becoming bound to these various spirits allowed them to channel the spirits magic, in return the more souls bound to the spirit the more powerful they became. As their power grew they, in turn, shaped their followers into forms complimenting their own power. Spirits of the mountains/stone eventually turned their followers into dwarves. Spirits of the forest into elves. Animal spirits created orcs and modern humans worshiped a single spirit of fire that ignited a firey passion in their spirit. Eventually these spirits became so powerful that they wiped out the primordial beasts and started clashing with each other. They threatened to wreck the world so eventually they agreed to an accord where they would limit their intervention through mortal followers. so now the gods exist in a sort of cold war. Various pantheons have formed (except for the humans fire god). Some seek to convert others seek to conquer.

Roughly each pantheon reflects a real world culture. Dwarves are Roman, orcs Scandinavian, elves are celts (old school, naked woad warrior picts and the like) humans are Byzantine. You have some far eastern analogs as well.', 'time': 1670856704, 'resto': 86918177}, {'no': 87010096, 'now': '12/12/22(Mon)16:07:36', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87002747
>Wars are won on logistics, so Khorne being a patron of the farmers that feed wars makes perfect sense
That actually does make a lot of sense. Still weird to think of his followers doing anything besides trying to offer up skills and things related to that though.', 'time': 1670879256, 'resto': 86918177}, {'no': 87014189, 'now': '12/12/22(Mon)22:57:08', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'filename': '4a1365f218cab5cc72ae196c88289372', 'ext': '.jpg', 'w': 518, 'h': 648, 'tn_w': 99, 'tn_h': 125, 'tim': 1670903828192755, 'time': 1670903828, 'md5': 'A1Ti40Ym0bUlOjxsAQCP1g==', 'fsize': 56545, 'resto': 86918177}, {'no': 87014883, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)00:39:56', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>86918177

[{'no': 87014988, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)00:51:41', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>86947417
>Right now you have a wild blend of going 1st or 2nd cards. MD has trained your brain to pack for anything but you don't need to do that in the TCG, just make your deck intending to go 1st or 2nd ideally and then make your side intended for the opposite.
That's one philosophy. I tend to prefer to set aside an even number of flex slots and go for a 50/50 split for the main, with the side to flex into a dedicated going first or going second setup. Though I have noticed recently with stuff like Triple Tactics Talents, the main has been getting more 'good going first or second' with dedicated tools to first/second in the side.', 'time': 1670910701, 'resto': 86940532}, {'no': 87015077, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:03:04', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014089
It's a bad play unless you are certain you can get game on board, and if I remember that duel right, that strategy was just enough to do exact lethal.', 'time': 1670911384, 'resto': 86940532}, {'no': 87015408, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)02:07:28', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014988
The problem with a "50/50 split" is that you less consistently see what side you will need. It leads to a bad mentality that "I went 1st/2nd this game and now my go-[opposite] stuff is dead in my hand at the moment. I should have packed for the opposite due to this anecdote".
IMO You will have to be playing through something turn 2/3 so having handtraps and select board breakers is generally more live than hard go first cards like floodgates. So it's generally better to pack the main with go-2nd cards and have the side contain blowout cards like floodgates and other go-2nd cards for the less expected matchups.
You can sometimes flip these two depending on if your deck is a go-2nd archetype but those are far fewer.', 'time': 1670915248, 'resto': 86940532}, {'no': 87015555, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)02:33:39', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': 'Can someone explain to me why sometimes it won't let me summon Union Carrier? What does it mean by "type" and "attribute"?
>type
I thought this meant winged beast/machine/etc. but sometimes I'll have 2 winged beasts out and I can't use them for material, but I can use one of them and another wind link monster (I can use the beast-warrior link monster with either of them, but not the two regular winged beasts together)
>attribute
I thought this meant earth/fire/etc. but there are some combos it refuses to work with. I was just playing a game and wanted to use 'maxx c' as a last-resort material for it alongside Tri-Bregade Kerass, and it wouldn't let me even though they're both earth.
If I can figure out the logic I think I can do a fair bit better, but it just isn't making sense to me right now.', 'filename': 'file', 'ext': '.png', 'w': 1423, 'h': 762, 'tn_w': 125, 'tn_h': 66, 'tim': 1670916819088431, 'time': 1670916819, 'md5': 'hYq4HA+nqSZuAz1xsMUq3g==', 'fsize': 1247204, 'resto': 86940532}, {'no': 87015942, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)03:45:49', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015555
What deck are you trying to use this in?
>Tri-Bregade
Tri-Brigade makes it so you can only use the tri beast types to link summon for the turn you use their effects. So you can't use maxx c since it's an insect.', 'time': 1670921149, 'resto': 86940532}]

com: What do you have to do to be a lich?
last_replies:
[{'no': 87014921, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)00:44:05', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>86994662
Not say "you're welcome" when thanked, then shortchange a dwarf by a couple coins.', 'time': 1670910245, 'resto': 86994662}, {'no': 87015413, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)02:08:09', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014921
>shortchange a dwarf by a couple coins.
yep, that's going in the book', 'time': 1670915289, 'resto': 86994662}, {'no': 87015415, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)02:09:05', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>Muh cycle of life!
Imagine defending the deaths of yourself, your loved ones, and everything to ever exist because it's "natural" that oblivion will consume everything. And you call liches evil?', 'time': 1670915345, 'resto': 86994662}, {'no': 87015451, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)02:14:45', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87009696
>and their toilet paper replaced with one pinecone on a stick
Was this really how certain peoples wiped their asses? I can't imagine how uncomfortable that would be.', 'time': 1670915685, 'resto': 86994662}, {'no': 87015774, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)03:17:23', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>86994662
Rip out your soul and stick it in a box, then broadcast your soul to your body. It's rather simplistic magically, but incredibly difficult to preform without dying.
The box needs to be designed to replicate the human form through magic, so that the soul can reside within without breaking free or going insane or just being stuck in a cage without any way of leaving. Using a Phylactery that's shaped like your own skull helps in this process since it mimics your own architecture.
You also need to create a soul-net and keep it powered throughout the ritual, and make sure that there's no big gaps in it so that your soul can slip out.
Thirdly, you need to force your mind and soul out of your body correctly. Best way to do this is with a magical solvent that melts the connections between body and the Mind plus soul.
Finally, though this is not technically required to become a lich, but to sustain yourself, is that you need to be able to pull the soul out of a person to shred to feed your own soul, since even with a human-like container, it will naturally decay on it's own over the course of centuries.
>>86996972
>Liches skin off people's faces with Simulacrums at night for fun.
Incorrect: Most liches just hang out for a million years studying magic in a cave they loaded with traps to both keep fools out, and to harvest the souls of said fools to keep on going. The Evil the average Lich preforms is out of pure, refined Apathy, rather than any form of Sadism.
This is, of course, not to say that all Liches are Apathetic. Some are Sadistic Motherfuckers that drink the blood of infants, but they're the type of fools that foolishly went to some demon library and got cursed with something that made them Stupidly Chaotic Evil while looking for eternal life. Or they're the powerhungry kind of fool that attracts too much attention to themselves and ensures their "lengthy immortality" lasts the span of a week.', 'time': 1670919443, 'resto': 86994662}]

If everyone is on board with the outset it isn't bad, but attempting to make that seem organic would be tough.', 'time': 1670909527, 'resto': 86934469}, {'no': 87015469, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)02:17:28', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014816
If it's required for the campaign, two options depending on your group's preference:
>let them know the start will be railroady, but try to accommodate the railroad for their characterisation. I.e. if they need to push the big red button, try to consider circumstances where it's at least justified that the character presses it
Or
>start the campaign after it has happened, potentially immediately if you want that continuity. Being knocked prone and looking up at the swirling nightmare vortex emerging from the box you just opened is a striking campaign starter. Keep context open and gradually fill it out in lulls in action, perhaps where you'd put commercial breaks. Have them be questions that give you or the player something to chew on: How long have you been searching for the box? Who did you screw over on your way to get it? Was it deliberate? How did you first hear of the box? This is the best way by far to write premades and it's really underused.', 'time': 1670915848, 'resto': 86934469}, {'no': 87015730, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)03:09:20', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014816
Make it their choice. Give them two choices.

Make both of them bad.

One of them is worse.', 'time': 1670918960, 'resto': 86934469}]

name: Anonymous
com: How good is the alchemist class in Pathfinder, and what's its niche? How do you like your alchemists to differentiate themselves in TRPGs? Also, post alchemist art.
last_replies:
[{'no': 87015075, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:02:28', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87014119
Alchemist is one of the best classes in terms of sheer abundance of mechanics and started the trend of all the new classes being powercreep improved version of bard. Without having to specialize, they get:
>Bombs that have the same scaling damage as a rogue's sneak attack, plus your Intelligence modifier and splash damage
>Spell slots and a spellbook that you can add spells to like a wizard. These are usually mixtures that only you can use.
>The ability to brew potions from your spell list that other people can use
>Special once per day power-ups that let you temporarily trade mental stats for physical stats
And that's just at level 1. You also get poison use and can pick a new class feature (like a rogue talent) every even level. These features include different modifications for your bombs, modifications for your power-ups, poison-related, or a bunch of fantasy-mad-science powers like a healing factor.

Calling the Alchemist 'generic' seems like taking the class for granted. You're given a lot to play with and you get more subclasses to pick from than there are classes in 5th edition, so you can trade one or some of the class features for something else. Really the only limit is your own creativity.', 'filename': '1521404420854', 'ext': '.jpg', 'w': 1000, 'h': 1000, 'tn_w': 125, 'tn_h': 125, 'tim': 1670911348944851, 'time': 1670911348, 'md5': 'b7DM6N2MykjrVuumfL7Pzg==', 'fsize': 270563, 'resto': 87014119}, {'no': 87015339, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)01:51:44', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>plague doctor outfit', 'filename': 'ugh', 'ext': '.jpg', 'w': 516, 'h': 516, 'tn_w': 125, 'tn_h': 125, 'tim': 1670914304026505, 'time': 1670914304, 'md5': 'VbF8va2+P/18Iyz43QFTjA==', 'fsize': 29609, 'resto': 87014119}, {'no': 87015379, 'now': '12/13/22(Tue)02:00:59', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87015339

name: Anonymous
com:
The basic premise is that humanity used to be a galaxy spanning empire, but some force has destroyed almost every human planet.
There are only nine human planets left now. Technically they're under one empire but realistically none of the planets are united. Each is basically its own isolated culture living under very sub-optimal conditions.
Something now threatens these nine planets.

The players aren't your traditional heros. They're some of the few people with ftl communication, and basically all they can do as a collective is communicate with eachtoher.
The game would be on a discord server and happen asynchronously, because that's almost exactly what the characters would be experiencing. They can only type so so can their players.
Most of the actual challenge is through weird logic puzzles, and negotiations with inhuman npcs.

Basically homestuck meets 40k. But I can't just lead with calling it that.

Are you trying to give me an erection', 'time': 1670893500, 'resto': 87002071}, {'no': 87012561, 'now': '12/12/22(Mon)20:10:03', 'name': 'Anonymous', 'com': '>>87005560
Roman.

Airburst mortars are area effect weapons that target a hex, and always deal full damage to every target in the hex. Every BA trooper in the hex would take 1 damage for every mortar that hits.
